message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.CL

This paper discusses the development of a logic-based framework to specify complex activities that is informed by activity theory, which is a framework used in human-computer interaction and related fields. This makes it likely that the paper would be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also introduces a new temporal logic, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of Answer-Set Programming as a KR shell for activity reasoning, which could place it under cs.CL (Computation and Language) or cs.CY (Computers and Society).
